exercises.prompt: You are in a meeting right now. You have an idea, but you decide not to speak. You are afraid ________ something wrong.
She avoids speaking in meetings because the experience always makes her nervous. She is afraid ________ in public.
The street looks dangerous at night, so people decide not to walk there. They are afraid ________ there after dark.
The path is icy, so we walk very carefully because we don't want an accident. We are afraid ________.
He has his phone in his hand but decides not to call his boss right now. He is afraid ________ him.
She feels stressed every time she has to call clients. In general, she is afraid ________ clients on the phone.
He is standing at the edge of the swimming pool but decides not to jump. He is afraid ________ into the water.
She doesn’t like swimming in the ocean because something bad might happen. She is afraid ________ attacked by a shark.
He knows he should tell his parents the truth, but he decides not to do it. He is afraid ________ them the truth.
She always worries about making mistakes when she writes in English. She is afraid ________ mistakes.
You finished your homework earlier than expected. You say: I have ________ finished my homework.
It started raining in the morning and it continues now. You say: It is ________ raining.
You are waiting for a reply, but it hasn’t arrived. You say: I haven’t received an answer ________.
You thought the store closed later, but you see the lights are off. You ask: Is the store closed ________?
She started studying two hours ago and continues now. She is ________ studying.
The meeting should have started, but it hasn’t. The manager isn’t here ________.
You paid the bill before the waiter asked. You say: I’ve ________ paid.
He expected to feel better after resting, but nothing changed. He is ________ tired.
You are asking about something that hasn’t happened, but you expect it soon. You ask: Have you finished ________?
You are surprised because it’s dark earlier than expected. You say: It’s dark ________!
He started working here years ago and continues now. He ________ works here.
The movie should have started, but it hasn’t. The movie hasn’t started ________.
She finished the report sooner than expected. She has ________ sent it.
You tried to understand the topic, but nothing changed. You ________ don’t understand it.
You are checking if something happened, but up to now it hasn’t. You ask: Has he called ________?
You are surprised because the time passed very fast. You ask: Is it 10 o’clock ________?
The computer was broken before and it continues broken now. It is ________ not working.
You expected a decision, but it hasn’t happened. They haven’t decided ________.
You completed the task earlier than planned. You say: I’ve ________ done it.
She had everything she needed, but the situation didn’t change. She is ________ unhappy.
Money is uncountable. Choose the correct option: A large ________ of money was stolen.
People are countable. Choose the correct option: A large ________ of people were waiting outside.
This sentence is formal and talks about objects: A huge ________ of oil was spilled into the sea.
Information is uncountable: There is a small ________ of information available.
Animals are countable: A large ________ of cows were infected.
This is a formal report style sentence: Large ________ of drugs were discovered.
Time is uncountable: I don’t have much ________ of time today.
Students are countable: A small ________ of students are absent today.
This sentence focuses on the total figure: The ________ of students is increasing every year.
Food is uncountable in general use: This ________ of food is enough for everyone.
Abstract noun: No ________ of love can fix this problem.
Reasons are countable: There are a ________ of reasons why I can’t go.
This sentence sounds like news or science: A large ________ of waste was produced.
Children are people and countable: Small ________ of children are educated at home.
Sugar is uncountable: Only a small ________ of sugar is needed.
Formal plural form: Huge ________ of oil were leaking into the sea.
Invitations are countable: A large ________ of invitations were sent.
Difficulty is uncountable: I had a certain ________ of difficulty understanding the topic.
This sentence focuses on statistics: The ________ of accidents has decreased this year.
This sentence sounds technical and formal: A significant ________ of chemicals was found.
Everyone attended the meeting. Richard was the only person who didn’t come. Complete the sentence: Everyone attended the meeting __________ Richard.
I like all vegetables. Tomatoes are the only ones I don’t like. I like all vegetables __________ tomatoes.
This sentence is in American English and means ‘except’. I don’t watch TV __________ the news.
The sentence means ‘in addition to’. Use the option that can mean ‘also’: __________ English, she also speaks French and German.
The hotel was perfect. The slow Wi-Fi was the only problem. The hotel was perfect __________ the slow Wi-Fi.
The meaning is ‘in addition to’, not ‘except’. __________ his full-time job, he also teaches online.
There is only one activity available here. Everything else is impossible. There’s nothing to do here __________ walking around the park.
John was the only person who disagreed. __________ John, everyone agreed with the decision.
The trip was good. The bad weather was the only negative point. The trip was enjoyable __________ the bad weather.
The sentence clearly adds information. Use the option meaning ‘also’: __________ Italy, they also visited Spain and Portugal.
This sentence means ‘except’. I eat very healthily __________ the occasional dessert.
The project was successful. There were only a few small problems. __________ a few minor issues, the project was successful.
Only one person knew the answer. No one else did. No one knew the answer __________ the teacher.
The meaning is ‘except’, not ‘in addition’. I don’t like any sports __________ basketball.
The sentence adds extra information. __________ a short delay, the flight was comfortable.
There were no plans, only one activity. She had no plans for the weekend __________ studying for exams.
Peter was the only student who didn’t submit the assignment. __________ Peter, everyone submitted it on time.
The city is generally quiet. The only noisy time is rush hour. The city is quiet __________ during rush hour.
The sentence clearly means ‘in addition to’. __________ English classes, he also teaches Spanish.
The report is complete. Only the references are missing. The report is complete __________ a few missing references.
We can walk __________ the bridge, but after that it's too dangerous.
The office is open __________ 6 p.m., so make sure you arrive before that.
I studied __________ Chapter 5, and then I took a break.
You can spend __________ $300 with this credit card.
I worked __________ midnight to finish the presentation.
During our hike, we reached __________ the glacier before turning back.
Our mobile plan includes __________ 10GB of data per month.
You can stay at my house __________ Sunday evening if you like.
In terms of grammar knowledge, I’ve learned __________ conditionals, but not reported speech.
She supported me __________ she could, but eventually I had to take responsibility.
I strongly __________ she’ll be able to finish the report on time; she’s been really busy lately.
He promised he would call, but I __________ he remembers.
Many experts __________ the new policy will reduce emissions effectively.
We __________ she is telling the truth; her story seems consistent.
I __________ he knows how serious this situation really is.
I never __________ he would show up. He’s always reliable.
Some people __________ the earth is flat, despite all scientific evidence.
I __________ we can finish this project without additional help.
There was a moment when I __________ she would actually win the competition.
You can rely on her. I __________ she’ll be here on time.
This suitcase is __________ heavy for me to carry alone.
She wasn’t strong __________ to move the furniture by herself.
There weren’t __________ chairs for all the guests.
It was __________ late to catch the last train.
He didn’t run fast __________ to win the race.
We had __________ food for the whole team.
This coffee is __________ hot to drink right now.
The house is not big __________ to host the party.
We arrived __________ early and had to wait for hours.
There was __________ noise in the room to make it hard to concentrate.
He refuses to accept __________________ he was wrong.
The meeting was delayed due to __________________ the CEO hadn’t arrived.
We cannot ignore __________________ sales have dropped for three quarters.
She’s upset about __________________ you didn’t invite her.
At the time, I didn’t realize __________________ she had already decided.
There’s no escaping __________________ the plan failed completely.
I was shocked by __________________ he never told me the truth.
My parents disapproved of __________________ my brother dropped out of college.
Despite __________________ he apologized, she stayed angry.
The report highlighted __________________ productivity had decreased across all departments.
The sun ______________ at 6:15 this morning.
Can you ______________ your hand if you have a question?
Temperatures are expected to ______________ again this weekend.
They plan to ______________ money for the new shelter.
She ______________ from her chair and walked to the podium.
The company ______________ its prices last month.
The balloon slowly ______________ into the sky.
He ______________ his eyebrows in surprise.
Wages have ______________ significantly in the last decade.
They ______________ concerns about the lack of safety protocols.
They live ______________ of Rome, near the industrial area.
We bought a small house ______________ to raise our family.
There’s a warehouse being built ______________ of the city.
Most people who live ______________ commute to the city center for work.
You’ll find logistics centers and factories ______________.
She grew up ______________ of a quiet American town, surrounded by parks and schools.
Their new office is located ______________ to save on rental costs.
Families with children often prefer living ______________ for the space and schools.
Traffic is usually lighter ______________ than downtown.
There’s a new shopping center opening ______________ of Birmingham next month.
She’s not available ______________. Can I take a message?
I remember clearly the feeling I had ______________ I saw her again.
We have no further information ______________.
She might arrive ______________, so stay ready.
He was silent ______________ before answering the question.
We were quite happy ______________, but things changed.
They started dating again, but ______________ they’re just friends.
I was too young to understand it ______________.
Try to be ______________ and enjoy the concert.
He changed completely ______________ he became a father.
